Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk pki-base
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: pki-core bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated pki-core packages that fix several bugs and add one enhancement are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) Core contains fundamental packages required by Red Hat Certificate System.
This update fixes the following bugs:
* Previously, entry Update Sequence Numbers (USN) were parsed as bounded integer values. This caused the server to fail to start in cases when the USN exceeded 2147483647. With this update, USNs are parsed as unbounded BigInteger values, and the server now successfully starts if USNs exceed this value. (BZ#1417066)
* The IPv4-specific "127.0.0.1" loopback address was previously used in the default server configuration file as the default AJP host name. This caused connections to fail on servers which run in IPv6-only environments. With this update, the default value is changed to "localhost", which works with both IPv4 and IPv6 protocols. Additionally, an upgrade script is available to automatically change the AJP host name on existing server instances. (BZ#1417190)
* Prior to this update, ECDSA certificates were issued with a NULL value in the "parameter" field. These certificates were not compliant with the RFC 5758 specification which mandates this field to be omitted completely. This bug has been fixed, and ECDSA certificates are now issued without the "parameter" field. (BZ#1417063)
* The issuance date of a certificate is retrieved from the "dateOfCreate" attribute in the LDAP certificate record. When migrating from an existing CA, if an entry was not initially created or if it was not updated during database import, the issuance date could be displayed incorrectly in both the web-based user interface and on the pki command line.
Two new parameters have been added to pkispawn to avoid this problem: "pki_ca_signing_record_create", which accepts boolean values and defaults to "True", and "pki_ca_signing_serial_number". When the first parameter is set to False, the certificate record with the serial number defined in the second parameter is removed before the end of the pkispawn configuration phase of the installation. Consequently, when the LDIF data is imported, the entry for the CA certificate is imported with the correct values, and the problem no longer occurs. (BZ#1417065)
In addition, this update adds the following enhancement:
* This update adds the "tcp.keepAlive" parameter to the CS.cfg configuration file. Use this parameter to configure the TCP keepalive option for all LDAP connections created by the PKI subsystem. The parameter takes a boolean value, and is set to "true" by default. (BZ#1417067)
Users of pki-core are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add this enhancement.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
